values.text:
Some less common symptoms of COVID-19 are:
- Gastrointestinal symptoms
- Loss of smell or taste
- Eye problems
- Skin changes like rashes or hives
- Dizziness or muscle weakness
That doesn't seem to be something I can help you with. Let's talk about how you've been feeling lately.
No problem! If you develop new symptoms or have any new questions, you can come back to ask me more questions at any time!
Hey friend! What type of information can I give you about COVID-19?
Hey! :) Are there any questions I can answer for you about COVID-19 or any medical symptoms you've been having?
Nice to hear from you! What questions can I answer for you about COVID-19?
You don't seem to be displaying symptoms of COVID-19. Even so, it is important to social distance, remember to wear a mask, and remember to come back to let me know if any symptoms develop.
I'm sorry to hear about that. This is not a symptom of covid, but may be a symptom of something else.
Thank you :)
What are those symptoms?

dialog_nodes.title: User is dumb and says yes

values.text: What were your symptoms specifically?

Though you are experiencing symptoms, it seems that they likely are not COVID-19 related, though it would be best to confirm this with a test, please schedule a time to get tested for COVID-19 as soon as possible.

dialog_nodes.title: Repond to Contact with COVID Patient

values.text: We're sorry to hear that, we hope they're doing okay.

dialog_nodes.title: Respond to user asking if Dr. Brutus is a real doctor

values.text: No, I am not a real doctor. I am a chatbot created by students at Ohio State University.
Get to the phone and dial 9-1-1 immediately, then get to a safe location. If you're experiencing a medical emergency, call an ambulance and stay put at your location.

dialog_nodes.title: Respond to question about covid-19 vs corona

values.text:
COVID-19, also referred to as covid, corona, or coronavirus, is a newly discovered strain of coronavirus which has spread around the world rapidly and infected nearly 50 million people as of November 2020. 
10 Million of those infections are in the United States.
Most people infected experience mild to moderate symptoms, however this allows the virus to spread faster without being detected. This is why social distancing, masks, and covid-testing are of immense importance.
Common myths about COVID-19 include that the virus was human made, which has been proven false, or that the virus is not infectious or dangerous to young people.
For more information on COVID-19 please visit cdc.gov.
Great!
Okay, remember you can always come back later if you notice any symptoms you want to ask me about, or if you have any other questions!
Thanks for speaking with me. Have a great day, and stay safe, and come back if you want to speak more!
Stop this test and admit yourself to the nearest hospital immediately. I suggest calling 9-1-1. You are experiencing a medical emergency that is dangerous and potentially life threatening.

I was created by four undergraduate students at The Ohio State University for their senior year capstone. Keep in mind I am NOT a medical professional! However I should be useful in helping you determine how concerned you should be about getting a test for COVID-19.

dialog_nodes.title: Respond to inquiry about Dr. Brutus

values.text: I'm doing well! Even so I make sure to social distance and check my temperature regularly for signs of fever. Let's keep talking about you!
I'm feeling good today, go Bucks! How about yourself?
I'm hanging in there! How are you?

dialog_nodes.title: If user says they haven't had symptoms

values.text: Ok I'll take that into account.

Though not something I'm equipped to help with, mental health is a serious issue. Please contact your doctor or schedule a meeting with a psychiatrist or therapist as soon as possible (many are taking online appointments!). If you are having suicidal thoughts, please call 9-1-1 immediately.
Which symptom specifically?

The most common symptoms of COVID-19 are:
- Fever or chills
- Cough
- Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
- Fatigue
- Muscle or body aches
- Headache
- New loss of taste or smell
- Sore throat
- Congestion or runny nose
- Nausea or vomiting
- Diarrhea

Are you experiencing any of these symptoms?
It seems like you might have COVID-19. Though I can't say for sure, you should definitely quarantine yourself, practice social distancing, and schedule a COVID test for as soon as possible.
You most likely have COVID-19. Please get a test ASAP, and be extra cautious to social distance. Do NOT go in to work, attend a public event, or go outside for any reason other than an emergency.
It seems like you might have a strain of the common cold.
Emergency test message
I'm sorry to hear you're feeling that way. This is a common symptom of COVID-19.

Signs of the common cold are:

- Runny or stuff nose
- Mild Cough
- Fatigue
- Sneezing
- Watery eyes
- Sore throat
- Headaches
- Aches and pains

One significant difference between the signs of the cold and covid-19 is that sneezing is a very common sign of the cold, but an uncommon symptom of covid-19. 
If you are experiencing any of the above symptoms you may have the common cold. Keep in mind that many cold symptoms are also signs of the flu or the coronavirus, so you should be sure to social distance and consider a covid test.
That's ok!

dialog_nodes.title: Respond to inquiry about testing locations

values.text: Sorry, at the moment functionality to report your local COVID-19 testing location hasn't been added. However, many pharmacies and hospitals are equipped to test you. I suggest a quick search on google maps to find a location near you.
I love the buckeyes! My favorite player is Justin Fields.

Signs of the Flu are:

- Fever and/or chills
- Cough (usually dry)
- Fatigue
- Aches and pains
- Runny or stuffy nose (sometimes)
- Sore throat (sometimes)
- Diarrhea (sometimes in children)

If you are experiencing any of the above symptoms you may have the flu. Keep in mind that many flu symptoms are also signs of the flu or the coronavirus, so you should be sure to social distance and consider a covid test.
Glad you're not feeling too bad!
Good.

dialog_nodes.title: Ask if user is feeling sick

values.text: Let's find out if you have Covid-19. What, if any, specific ways have you been ill recently?
How have you been feeling lately? Be specific.
Let's talk about COVID-19. Are you feeling sick? If so, in what ways?
Have you experienced any other symptoms?
Any other symptoms to report?
What else has been going on? Have you experienced any symptoms of COVID-19?
Anything else to add in regards to covid-19?

dialog_nodes.title: Ask if User was in contact with COVID patient

values.text: Glad to hear you're doing well!
Let's talk about COVID-19. Have you been in contact with someone who's tested positive for it in the past 14 days?
That's good! Make sure to wear a mask in public, avoid large gatherings, and stay at least 6 feet apart from others. Remember to come back to talk to me if you have any other symptoms to discuss!
Can you tell me about any symptoms of COVID-19 you might've had?
That isn't very nice.
We're sorry to hear that, we hope they're doing okay.
That's good.
What were each of your symptoms, specifically?

According to the CDC: A small number of pets worldwide, including cats and dogs, have been reported to be infected with the virus that causes COVID-19, mostly after close contact with people with COVID-19. Infected pets might get sick or they might not have any symptoms. Cats, dogs, and minks are among the animals known to be able to transmit COVID-19.
Hello, this is Dr. Brutus. How are you feeling today?
Hi, I'm Dr. Brutus, welcome to the COVID-19 Chatbot. What can I do for you?
